ETYMOLOGY: From Middle English, from Old French excellent, from Latin excellens, present participle of excellere 'to rise up, surpass' (ex- 'out of' + -cellere 'to rise high').

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Extremely good; of the highest quality or standard.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 极好的；卓越的；杰出的；出色的。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The team delivered an excellent presentation that impressed the clients.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这个团队做了一个出色的演示，给客户留下了深刻印象。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Interjection (used alone or at the start of a sentence)
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Used to express great pleasure, approval, or satisfaction regarding a plan or outcome.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 太棒了！好极了！（表示非常满意或赞同）
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: “You got the promotion!” “Excellent! All that hard work paid off.”
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: “你得到升职了！” “太棒了！所有的努力都得到了回报。”
